We are trying to determine if a 6-sided die is fair, which means that each side has an equal probability of landing face-up. In this case, each side should have a 1/6 chance of being rolled.

With 1000 rolls, we would expect each side to appear approximately 166 times (1000 / 6). If any side appears significantly more or less often than 166 times, it would indicate that the die is biased.

Inference: Rolling the die 1000 times is a much more reliable way to determine if the die is fair.
